Thank you, Doctor. Bane snaps Dr. Pavel's neck in front of the world.

The bomb is armed, the bomb is mobile, the identity of the triggerman is a mystery. One of you holds the detonator - we come not as conquerors, but as liberators to return control of this city to the people. At the first sign of interference from the outside world or of people attempting to flee, this anonymous Gothamite, this unsung hero, will trigger the bomb. For now, martial law is in effect. Return to your homes, hold your families close, and wait. Tomorrow you claim what is rightfully yours. Bane turns, leaves the field, followed by his men.
The General breaks the silence. 105.
Pull back the fighters, start high-level reconnaissance flights. And get the President on the line.
Mercenaries hold the bridge. A tank rolls across from the mainland, soldiers behind. The Lead Mercenary uses a bullhorn.
Tanks and planes cannot stop us detonating our device. Send an emissary to discuss terms of access for supplies and communication. A Captain steps forward, walks to the apex of the bridge.
How many of you are there, son? (Nothing.) You don't have enough men to stop twelve million people leaving that island.
We don't. But you do.
Why in the hell would we help you keep your hostages?
If people start crossing this bridge Gotham gets blown to hell. The Captain considers this. Troubled.
As night falls the F-22's peel away from the fire-ringed city. The voice of the President echoes across the airwaves...
The people of our greatest city are resilient. They have proven this before, they will prove this again... 106.
Wayne stares at the old TV. At his burning city.
We do not negotiate with terrorists, but we do recognize realities... Wayne starts to cry.
Blake drives the deserted streets. Gordon is slumped in t passenger seat, listening.
As the situation develops, one thing must be understood above all others... People of Gotham, we have not abandoned you.
What does that mean?
It means we're on our own. I have to get in front of a camera -
Sir, they'll kill you the second you show your face -
The Mayor's dead. I'm the symbol of law and order. Bane says he's giving Gotham back to the people - they need to know that I could lead.
Bane's not gonna let that happen -
Then he'll show his true colors.
And you'll be dead. Gordon says nothing. 107.
Three camouflage Tumblers roll down the deserted street.
A crowd of news crews has gathered. Guards in the towers look down, apprehensive. The Tumblers roll up, stopping i front of the gates. Bane emerges from the lead Tumbler.
Behind you stands a symbol of oppression. Blackgate Prison...
Prisoners strain to hear Bane's words. Selina is there.
Where a thousand men have languished for years. Under the Dent Act. Under the name of this
Bane holds up a photo of Harvey Dent.
Harvey Dent. Held up to you, and over you, as a shining example of justice and good...
Gordon sits watching Bane's speech. Blake gathers supplie
We're gonna keep moving you, till we can get you in front of a camera
Bane sets fire to the picture of Dent... 108.
But they supplied you a false idol. A straw man. To placate. To stop you tearing down this corrupt city...
The Prisoners start cheering, shouting.
...and rebuilding it the way it should have been rebuilt generations ago...
Bane drops the burning picture.
Let me tell you the truth about Harvey Dent. In the words of Gotham's Police Commissioner, James Gordon...
This gets Blake's attention. Gordon watches, uneasy...
Bane unfolds the pages of Gordon's undelivered speech...

'The truth about Harvey Dent is simple in only one regard - it has been hidden for too long. After his devastating injuries, Harvey's mind has recovered no better than his mutilated face. He was a broken, dangerous man, not the crusader for justice that I, James Gordon, have portrayed him to be for the last eight years. Harvey's rage was indiscriminate. Psychopathic. He held my family at gunpoint, then fell to his death in the struggle over my son's life. The Batman did not murder Harvey Dent - he saved
my boy. Then took the blame for Harvey's appalling crimes, so that I could, to my shame, build a lie around this fallen idol.'
Blake stares at the TV, Gordon's face lowers into his hands...
'I praised the madman who tried to murder my own child.'
The crowd is silent, stunned, as Bane continues to read.

'The things we did in Harvey's name brought desperately needed security to our streets... But I can no longer live with my lie. It is time to trust the people of Gotham with the truth, and it is time for me to resign.' Bane folds the papers. Looks out to the stunned crowd. Do you accept this man's resignation? Individuals in the crows start shouting 'Yes!'
Prisoners cheer, pounding against the bars. Selina watches...
Do you accept the resignation of all the liars?! All the corrupt?! More and more of the crowd is chanting 'Yes!' 110.
Blake turns to Gordon, who stares at the TV.
These men, locked up in Blackgate for eight years, denied parole under the Dent Act. Based on a lie.
A lie to keep a city from burning to the ground. Gotham needed a hero, someone to believe in -
Not as much as it does now. But you betrayed everything you stood for.

(looks at Blake) There's a point. Far out there. When the structures fail you. When the rules aren't weapons anymore, they're shackles, letting the bad get ahead. Maybe one day you'll have such a moment of crisis. And in that moment, I hope you have a friend like I did. To plunge their hands into the filth so you can keep yours clean.
Your hands look pretty filthy to me, Commissioner. Gordon stares at him. Blake goes back to packing.
Bane signals a Tumbler - its turret turns to the prison doors.

We take Gotham from the corrupt. The rich. The oppressors of generations who've kept you down with the myth of opportunity. And we give it to you, the people. Gotham is yours - none shall interfere. Do as you please... The Tumbler fires, blowing the doors to hell.
But start by storming Blackgate and freeing the oppressed... Step forward, those who would serve... Bane's men surge through the burning gates...
Selina watches as Prisoners stream out of open cell doors She makes her way quietly through the excited throng.
For an army will be raised... Mercenaries hand out weapons to escaping Prisoners...
As Mercenaries shoot open locks, people storm into expens apartment buildings overlooking the park...
The powerful will be ripped from their decadent nests...
People ransack the apartment...
...and cast into the cold world the rest of us have known and endured...
Wealthy people are herded onto the street by Mercenaries.
Courts will be convened...
A kangaroo court is in session, presided over by a Crimin we recognize from Blackgate. Bane watches from the gallery... 112.
The spoils will be enjoyed...
Tough-looking Revellers crack open champagne - spraying i swigging it - Selina amongst them, watching...
Blood will be shed...
Hundreds of Police living underground. Dividing up suppli lowered by ropes... Ross opens a pack of supplies.
But the police will live, until they are ready to serve true justice...
Moving in on the bright glow of the core...
This great city will endure... Close enough to see the flickering digits of its countdown...
Gotham will survive. Mercenaries load the core into the back of a black truck.
Wayne rolls off his cot. Grunts. The Prisoner realizes Wa is trying to do a push-up. From the next cell, the Blind Prisoner says something...
He says you must first straighten your back. The Prisoner helps Wayne roll over, painfully. 113.
How would he know?
He was the prison doctor. A morphine addict who incurred the displeasure of powerful people. Including your masked friend.
How?
Many years ago, during a time of plague, Bane was attacked by other prisoners. The doctor's fumbling attempts to repair the damage left him in perpetual agony. The mask holds his pain at bay.
Is Bane the child you spoke of? Was he born here?
The legend is that there was a mercenary working for the local warlord who fell in love with his daughter. They married in secret. The Prisoner takes a rope - ties it under Wayne's arms.
When the warlord found out, he condemned the mercenary to this pit. But then exiled him instead. INSERT CUT: the Mercenary is dropped at the side of a bar road. He starts to walk.

The mercenary understood that the warlord's daughter had secured his release, but he couldn't know the true price of his freedom. She had taken his place in the pit. INSERT CUT: a Woman is lowered into the prison. The prisoners below all have their faces covered with muslin masks... 114.

And she was with the child. The mercenary's child. INSERT CUT: the Woman watches as the Doctor, (the Blind Prisoner, younger-looking, sighted) examines her small child. The Doctor exits, locking the cell...
One day the doctor forgot the lock the cell... INSERT CUT: Prisoners move into the cell towards his moth The child runs at them with a knife...

Innocence cannot flower underground. It was to be stamped out. But the child had a friend. A protector... INSERT CUT: the Protector, face covered, pulls the Child the attackers. One grabs for the Child - the Protector sn his arm, carries the Child into a corner...
...who showed the others that this innocence was their redemption. The mother was not so lucky. The Blind Prisoner shouts at the Prisoner. He nods.

This is Bane's prison now. Bane would not want this story told. The Prisoner pulls - Wayne screams in pain as he is pulle upright. The Prisoner ties him off. Checks his spine. You have a protruding vertebra...I'm going to force it back...
How -? The Prisoner punches Wayne in the back, hard. Wayne screa
You stay like this. Until you stand. Wayne passes out from the pain and we FADE TO BLACK. Wayne is hanging in his cell, delirious. 115.
Did you not think I'd return, Bruce? R 's al Gh l, in his Ducard guise, steps in front of Wayn
I told you I was immortal.
I watched you die.
There are many forms of immortality. Wayne looks inward, remembering... INSERT CUT: R 's at the campfire (from Batman Begins).
Once I had a wife. My great love. She was taken from me... INSERT CUT: the Woman is lowered into the prison... Wayne looks at R 's.
You were the mercenary. Bane is your child. Your heir. INSERT CUT: the Mercenary at the side of the road. R 's.
An heir to ensure the League of Shadows fulfills its duty to restore balance to civilization.
No...

You yourself fought the decadence of Gotham for years. With all your strength and resources, all your moral authority. And the only victory you could achieve was a lie. Finally you understand... Gotham is beyond saving... 116.
And must be allowed to die. CUT TO WHITE. And we are -
Snow blankets the street. A Tumbler carves tracks as it patrols the deserted street. Blake peers from behind a parked car - he is crouched, feeding a kite string down a storm drain.
Ross strains to reach a note dangling on a string - he grasps it. All around him are dozens of Cops living underground...
Blake winds the string, picks up a jerrycan, hurries off.
The home is packed. People, not just kids, huddle in ever corner. Blake spots Father Reilly. Hands him the can.
For the bus in case there's a chance to evacuate. Keep it in here - people are siphoning parked cars.
Really?
How do you think I got it?
Right. Any news? Is the
Less you know, Father. How're the boys? 117.
Power's been on more, so they get some TV. Blake smiles. Moves to the door. Blake, you be careful out there. They're hunting down cops like dogs. Blake nods. Leaves.
Following Selina through rooms strewn with trash, empty bottles and sleeping partygoers. She spots a family photograph, glass smashed. A hand lands on her shoulder.
Who's that?
This was someone's home.
Now it's everyone's home. Selina stares out at a Tumbler rolling by.
'Storm's coming', remember? This is what you wanted.
No. It's what I thought I wanted.
The Prisoner unties the rope from Wayne's chest. Wayne stands. Just. Then walks.
Wayne does push-ups. Stronger. The Prisoner watches.
Why build yourself?
I'm not meant to die in here. The Prisoner indicates the TV: 118. SIEGE OF GOTHAM: DAY 84.
Here? There? What's the difference? Wayne ignores this. Focuses on his body...

Wayne moves to the wall - takes the rope from the Tattooe Prisoner, wraps it around his chest. Curious Prisoners gather, the Prisoner at their head. Wayne looks up at the light, hundreds of feet above. Starts to climb. Prisoners get excited as Wayne RISES - money starts exchanging hand Reaching the precipice, he checks his rope, looks up at t next handhold, far away. He takes a breath, then LEAPS. His fingers brush the ledge. Wayne DROPS a hundred feet - the rope catches, SLAMMING him into the rock face. The Prisoners disperse, losing interest as the Tattooed Priso lowers Wayne on the rope. The Blind Prisoner turns away.
I told you it could not be done.
You told me a child did it...

No ordinary child... INSERT CUT: the Protector fights off prisoners as the Chi older now, moves to the climbing wall A child born in hell. INSERT CUT: the Child makes the climb...pauses, looking d - making eye-contact with the Protector, who fights off Prisoners... They swarm over the Protector, knives drawn. A child forged by suffering, hardened by pain... INSERT CUT: the Child leaps across the abyss, grabbing a handhold on the ledge and swinging up... Not a man from privilege. Wayne's eyes close in despair. 119.
Supply trucks await inspection. Mercenaries open an 18-wheeler - check boxes of rations...wave it on...
The 18-wheeler pulls up. A line of Gothamites waits patiently along the sidewalk.
Three plain-clothes Special Forces Men emerge from the boxes, checking, then concealing weapons. The doors open they exit.
The Special Forces Men carry boxes into the store as if delivering. The Store Manager leads them into the back an down into -
Where they are met by four Cops out of uniform.
You have ID?
Of course not.
How can we trust you?
We don't have any choice. Gordon and Blake emerge from the back of the room.
Commissioner Gordon? Captain Jones, Special Forces.
Captain, glad to have you here. 120.
How many of you are there?
Dozens. I'd rather not say exactly. But the men trapped underground number almost three thousand.
What kind of shape they're in?
They've been getting water, food.
Could we break them out?

Yes, sir - take out the mercenaries guarding the outflow south of Ackerman Park, blow the rubble, you've got a hole big enough for ten at a time. I'm in contact with my partner - they're waiting for the day.
Men who haven't seen daylight for three months?
Men with automatic weapons who haven't seen daylight in three months.
What about the bomb? The satellites can't see any radiation hot spots...
Blake scouts with Jones. A rumble makes them turn.
They keep it on a truck - it must have a lead-lined roof. They move it constantly.
But you know the truck? 121.

They've got three of them. The routes don't vary much. Two Tumblers lead a massive black truck down the street. Captain Jones reaches into his jacket and triggers a Geig counter. Shows Blake the display. Nods. One of the Tumble stops, turns back. Blake leads them down a side street.
What about the triggerman?
No leads. It's a bluff - Bane wouldn't give control of that bomb to someone else.
We can't take that chance. Until we have the triggerman, we just track the device, smuggle men over -
While Gotham lives under a warlord, like in some failed state?
Dial it back, officer. This situation is unprecedented. We can't do anything to risk millions of lives.
Aren't you gonna tell him?!
Captain, things are more complicated than you think. There's somebody you need to meet. Blake? Blake nods, leads Jones and his men up the stairs.
Blake leads them to the door of an empty bank. 122.
They head across the empty lobby to an elevator.
Blake leads them into empty offices. Cots and makeshift furnishings line the offices and corridors.
I was up here looking for a vantage point. Found the people who run the corporation who owns it living here.
Which corporation?
Wayne Enterprises. Lucius Fox is there, with Miranda Tate.
Captain, meet Mr. Fox. Mr. Fox, I'd like you to brief the Captain. Captain Jones indicates Miranda.
Miss Tate is fully aware of the situation.
And as CEO of Wayne Enterprises, I have to take responsibility for it.
Why?
Because, Captain, we built it.
You built the bomb?
It was built as a fusion reactor. The first of its kind. Bane turned the core into a bomb, then disconnected it from the reactor. 123.
And here's the important part.
As the device's fuel cells decay, it's becoming increasingly unstable...until the point of detonation.
The bomb's a time bomb.
And it will go off. In twenty-three days. Captain Jones reels at this news.

Bane's revolution is a sham. He's watching Gotham rearrange its deckchairs while the whole ship's going down. Your appeasement plan might not be as practical as you thought. Captain Jones throws Blake a look. Addresses Fox.
Could you disarm it?
I don't know, But I could reconnect it to the reactor. Stabilize it.
We'd have to let the Pentagon know.
They'll be monitoring our
We have no choice. Let's move away from this location, then call it in. 124.

Captain Jones exits the elevator, followed by his men and Blake. Halfway across the floor, hell breaks loose. Mercenaries blast them with machine guns - the lobby beco a devastating ambush. Blake dives back into the elevator.
Blake flies out of the elevator.
Fox, somebody sold us out! Fox and Miranda burst into the corridor.
Take Miranda - Blake grabs Miranda, heads for the back stairs. Mercenari jump out of the elevator, firing high.
Fox freezes. Lowers himself to the ground.
Captain Jones goes down in a hail of bullets. The other Special Forces Men are down. Bane enters, midges Jones wi his toe. He is alive. Barely. Bane leans in close. Jones looks up at him, defiant.
I'll die before I talk...
I'm on your schedule, Captain. Bane places his hand over Jones's nose and mouth.
There were people living upstairs. Bane looks up, disinterested. Jones is dead.
Give them over for judgement. (Indicates bodies.) Hang them where the world will see. 125.
Wayne stares at the TV: the Special Forces bodies hang in the cables of Gotham Bridge. Wayne throws a stone into th screen.
Wayne does endless push-ups, squats, stretches. The Blind Prisoner listens. He speaks in an ancient tongue.
He says the leap to freedom is not about strength.
My body makes the jump.
Survival is the spirit. The soul.
My soul's as ready to escape as my body.
Fear is why you fail.
I'm not afraid. I'm angry. Wayne throws punches...focused.

Wayne takes the rope at the foot of the climb. Prisoners look up, but none bother to gather round. Wayne starts climbing, determined. He FIGHTS the rock face...breathing hard. Grabs at a rock it comes away in his hand. He DROPS - SMASHES into the ro face. The Blind Prisoner shakes his head. A Skinny Prisoner playing cards with the Prisoner looks u at Wayne, hanging upside down.
Shouldn't you get him down? The Prisoner glances up at Wayne, disdainful. 126.
He'll keep. As Wayne drifts into unconsciousness we - INSERT CUT: Young Bruce lies at the bottom of the well, looking up at his father, lowering down to rescue him.
And why do we fall?
Wayne wakes with a start - the Blind Prisoner is there.
You do not fear death. You think this makes you strong. This makes you weak.
Why?

How can you move faster then possible? Fight longer than possible? If not from the most powerful impulse of the spirit. The fear of death. The will to survive. Wayne gets up onto his elbow. Looks at the Blind Prisoner
I do fear death. I fear dying in here while my city burns with no one there to save it.
Then make the climb.
How?
As the child did. Without the rope. (Dry laugh.) Then fear will find you again. Wayne considers this. 127.
Wayne puts some scraps of bread into a rough coat which h folds into a makeshift shoulder pack.

Supplies for your journey? Prisoners nearby laugh. Wayne moves to the cliff face. Th Prisoner follows, intrigued by Wayne's new demeanor. The Tattooed Prisoner offers him the rope. Wayne refuses. Sta to climb. Prisoners gather around as word spreads. Wayne makes his way cautiously up the treacherous rock face. Do below the Prisoners start a low chant. As Wayne hoists himself up onto the precipice something EXPLODES from the cliff face. Wayne flinches - BATS... Th circle up to the opening above... Wayne closes his eyes. The chant RISES. Wayne takes a breath...opens his eyes...looks down at the drop...up again...then he jumps. Time skips a beat as the Prisoners stop breathing. And Wayne GRABS the ledge above. The Prisoners go WILD as Wayne hoists himself up onto the ledge. The Blind Prisoner nods. Wayne climbs to FREEDOM.
Wayne climbs out of the hole and into formidable desolati He shoulders his pack - spots a large coil of rope attach to the wall. He pushes it into the hole then walks away..
A mass of huddled Gothamites. Professionals (traders, industrialists). In a corner, Fox. Mercenaries come down into the chamber, pull out a man, who starts yelling. It Stryver, Daggett's functionary.
I want to see Bane! There's been a mistake! Take me to Bane! Fox watches him dragged upstairs... 128.
A kangaroo court. Stryver is dragged before a jeering cro
There's been a mistake! Where's Bane?!
There's been no mistake, Mr. Stryver. Stryver turns to look at the 'judge': Dr. Jonathan Crane.

You are Philip Stryver, executive vice-president of Daggett Industries? (Off nod from Stryver.) The same Philip Stryver who for years lived like a prince off the blood and sweat of people less powerful?
Call Bane! I'm one of you! Jeers. Pull back to reveal a silent figure, watching. Ban
Bane has no authority here. This is merely a sentencing hearing. The choice is yours, death or exile. Stryver looks around, terrified, as the crowd shouts 'Death'.
Exile.
Sold...to the man in the cold sweat! Mercenaries pull Stryver from the dock...
Stryver, with other wealthy Gothamites, is led down to th ice. A Blackgate Inmate undoes his handcuffs, whispering. 129.
Follow the tick ice. Try to swim - you're dead in minutes.
Has anyone made it? The Blackgate Inmate turns away. Stryver is forced onto t ice. He shuffles forward, listening to the creaking... Stryver is a hundred yards out when the river swallows hi
Gordon stands over a map of the city. A handful of Cops s around the room. Waiting. Gordon looks at his watch.
Where the hell are they? It's not like we have a lot of time, here.
How long?
The bomb goes off tomorrow. We've got about eighteen hours to do something.
To do what?
We mark that truck. Get a GPS on it, then we can start thinking about how to take it down. The door opens and Blake enters, followed by ten cops. Gordon is counting them in. He moves to Blake.
That's it? Blake just looks at him. Gordon checks the faces. Realize
Foley. Where's Foley, dammit?! Gordon heads for the door. 130.
You shouldn't be out on the streets
Gordon hurries up the steps to a brownstone. Stabs the be
Jim. He's not here - Gordon, furious, addresses the hallway behind her.
You're sending your wife to the door when the city's under occupation?! Foley appears at the end of the corridor. Ashamed.
Wait in the kitchen, honey.
What did you do, bury your uniform in the backyard?
Jim, you saw what they did to those Special Forces.
You forgotten all the years we went out on patrol with every gangbanger wanting to plant one as soon as our backs were turned?
This is different and you know it. These guys run the city - the government's done a deal with them
Deal?! Bane's got their balls in a vice. That's not a deal -
You move against Bane, the triggerman's gonna hit the button - 131.
You think he's given control of that bomb to one of 'the people'?! You think this is part of some revolution? There's one man with his finger on the button - Bane.
We have to keep our heads down until they can fix this. If you still had family here maybe you'd -
This only gets fixed from inside the city, Foley. (Calmer.) Look, I'm not asking you to walk down Grand in your dress blues. But we've got to do something before this maniac blows us all to hell.
I'm sorry Jim. I gotta -
Keep your head down? What's that gonna do tomorrow, when that thing blows?
You don't know that's going to happen. Foley closes the door on Gordon. Gordon stands there.
I hear you're looking for men, Commissioner. Gordon turns to see Miranda, Blake behind her. Blake shru
How about me, instead?
Miss Tate, I can't ask you -
My company built it.
Bruce Wayne built it. 132.
And he wanted to destroy it. It was me who didn't listen. Please. Gordon looks at Blake. Then Miranda. Nods.
Let's go.
A Kid sprints down the deserted street, chased by two Gangbangers. The Kid slips in the snow - the men are on h

You steal from us, you little bastard? They grab the Kid's backpack, the Gangbanger pulls out an apple, moves to hit the Kid when - SMACK! - his hand is grabbed, and the apple flies into the air as his arm crac Selina catches the apple.

You boys know you can't come into my neighborhood without asking politely. Gangbanger 2 lunges with a knife - she spins him, making stab himself in the backside. The Gangbangers run off, howling. The Kid eyes her, wary.
Never steal anything from someone you can't outrun, kid.
Now you're gonna take it. Selina looks at the red apple. Takes one perfect bite.
Just tax. She tosses him the apple. He takes it and runs.
Pretty generous, for a thief. Selina recognizes the voice. Turns to find Wayne - strong but weathered. Beard, work clothes. 133.
You came back. I thought they'd killed you.
Not yet.
If you're expecting an apology -
It wouldn't suit you. I need your help.
And why would I help you? Wayne pulls a USB drive out of his pocket.
For this. The 'Clean Slate'.
You're gonna trust me with that? After what I did to you?

I admit I felt a little let down. But I still think there's more to you. In fact, I think for you - (indicates USB) this isn't a tool, it's an escape route. You want to disappear. Start fresh. She looks at him. Takes the drive, staring at it.
Start fresh? I can't even get off this island.
I can give you a way off. Once you've gotten me to Lucius Fox. I need you to find out where they're holding him. Then take me in.
Why do you need Fox?
To save this city. 134.
Who says it needs saving? Maybe I like it this way.
Maybe you do. But tomorrow that bomb's going off.
Get your powerful friend on the case.
I'm trying. But I need Fox.
Gordon and his Men are in two-man teams. Gordon is walkin down the street with Miranda. He hands her a Geiger count

Stay further up the block. (Points at Men.) They're gonna cross the street and try and slow the truck down. As it approaches, hit this button. If the needle hits two hundred - give me the signal and I mark the truck. Okay?

Heads up. Blake is up on a rooftop. Gordon moves down to the other of the block. As the truck rumbles into view, Gordon's Me walk out into the street in front of it as if crossing th road. The convoy barely slows. Miranda gives Gordon the signal. As the truck comes past, he tosses a magnetic GPS locator at the lower part of the truck... Gordon regroups with his Men on the corner. Checks his GP
Got it. They keep moving, turning down the next street...into an ambush. Dozens of Mercenaries, weapons trained.
Commissioner Gordon, you're under arrest. 135.
On whose authority?
The people of Gotham. Blake, from his vantage point, watches Gordon, Miranda an the other Cops being rounded up and led away...
Miranda comforts a crying Woman in the corner. Thugs come down the stairs, laughing, leading a Hooded Prisoner. The kick him down the last step and he stumbles. Fox moves to his aid.
Find this one a spot, he's got a big day tomorrow. They dump the Hooded Man with Fox.
We all do. It's not every day you bag Bruce Wayne... Fox hears this. Pulls the bag from Wayne's head. Wayne no at him, silent. Fox nods back. The Thugs leave. Miranda comes over.
Bruce?
You picked a hell of a time to go on vacation, Mr. Wayne.
How long until the core ignites?
That bomb goes off in twelve hours.
Unless we can connect it to the reactor.
If you can get it there. I'll find a way to plug it back in. (Indicates Miranda.) Can you get Miranda out? 136.
Not tonight. I'm sorry.
Do what's necessary.
Tonight I need you.
What for?
To get me back in the game. Catwoman comes down the stairs with the Thugs.
Sorry to spoil things, boys, but Bane wants these guys himself... The thugs pull Wayne and Fox to their feet - Miranda look up.
I won't forget about you.
I know.
The Thugs lead Wayne and Fox along the colonnade. Catwoma spins, takes out one Thug with a heel, one with a punch t the throat. Fox smiles as she unlocks his wrists.
I like your girlfriend, Mr. Wayne.
He should be so lucky. And she's gone. Fox turns to Wayne. Who shrugs.
Lights flicker on... Wayne and Fox are in the Bat-Bunker. 137.
Any move I make against Bane or the bomb - the triggerman sets it off.

They can't be using radio or cell - too much interference. Infrared doesn't have the range. It could only be micro-burst long wave... Wayne opens a panel in the wall, takes out equipment: mini-mines, Batarangs, utility belt...
Could you block it?
Yes. I need the EMP cannon-guidance mount from the Bat. You remember where you parked? Wayne nods. Smiles. The Batsuit rises from the floor...
Gordon and his men on trial. Crane presides.
The charges are espionage and attempted sabotage... Do you have anything to say in your defense?
No lawyer, no witnesses. What sort of due process is this?
More than you give Harvey's prisoners, Commissioner. Your guilt is determined, this is merely a sentencing hearing. What's it to be, death or exile?
Crane, if you think we are going willingly out onto that ice, you've got another think coming.
Death, then? 138.
Looks that way.
Very well... Death... (Smiles.) By exile. He smashes his gavel. Bane leans in to one of his men, indicates Miranda.
Bring her to me.
Wayne bounds up the stairs. Fox follows, out of breath
I think it's time to talk about my year-end bonus...
Fox emerges to see Wayne uncovering the Bat... As the sun sets, Fox starts pulling apart the gun mount.
She fly pretty well?
Even without the autopilot...
Autopilot? That's what you're there for.

Gordon and the rest of the men stand at the edge of the i A Mercenary fires his gun in the air. Gordon takes a brea then leads his men onto the ice...which creaks and groans Further out, Gordon stops - sniffs - looks down: a pool o liquid, beside it: a flare. Gordon picks it up, puzzled.
Light it up. 139. Gordon, energized by the familiar voice, lights the flare jams it into the liquid, sending a trail of FIRE across t ice - up into a building where it forms the shape of a BAT...
Dad! Check it out!
Honey, take a look! Foley moves to a back window. Sees the flaming sign.
A Mercenary nervously approaches Bane's back.
Sir? Bane turns. The Mercenary points at the sign.
You think it's really him?
Impossible...
Foley yanks up the floorboards. Pull his dress blues from their hiding place.
Mercenaries guarding the entrance see the sign. One of th moves out to get a better look. WHAM! He is taken out by dark figure. The figure steps into the light - it is Blake...
Batman hands Gordon a metal box. 140.
This blocks the remote detonator signal to the bomb. Get it onto the truck by sunrise. They might hit the button when it starts.
When what starts?
War.

Blake takes out a second Mercenary - moves over to the op manhole. Ross emerges - nots at Blake, who helps him clim out. BANG - Ross goes down as Blake dives for cover. Blak is grabbed by Mercenaries. They detonate the manhole, sealing it, prepare to execute Blake. A dark shape drops onto the Mercenaries... Blake watches, in awe, as Batman takes them out in a fury of punches and kicks - then it i finished. Quiet. One of the Mercenaries moves slightly.
You missed a spot. Batman boots him in the head as he moves towards Blake.
If you're working alone, wear a mask.
No one cares who I am.
The mask is not for you. It's to protect the people you care about.
Huh. And you always seem to know where those people are. How is that?

I lost someone once. Since then I break into their homes when they're sleeping and implant a tracking device on the back of their neck. Blake laughs. Then feels the back of his neck. Batman tos Blake a mini-mine. 141.
On three - one, two, three - They throw the mini-mines at the rubble of the entrance - the blasts barely move any rubble.
No offense, but you got anything bigger in that belt?
That's to warn the men on the other side. Batman disappears into the shadows.
But how do we -? KAABOOOM! The Bat's cannons light up the night.
Okay. Cops climb out into the cold night - skinny, ragged, but glad to be alive and carrying guns...
What now?
All-out assault on Bane...but you need to get the people you care about across the bridge.
Why?
In case we fail. Lead an exodus across the bridge. Save as many lives as you can.
Don't you need me here?
You've given me an army. Now go. Blake nods. Turns to leave. Stops. 142.
Thank you.
Don't thank me yet.
I might not get a chance later. Batman nods. Blake disappears into the night.
Gordon checks the metal box. Puts it under his coat. Nods his men, hiding in the doorways. Checks his GPS...
Batman leads Catwoman to a rusty old container. He opens revealing the Bat-Pod. Catwoman's eyes light up.
Oh, you shouldn't have... She hops on, feeling the controls.
The mid-town tunnel's blocked by debris, but the cannons give you enough firepower to make a path for people. Catwoman marvels at the controls...
To start it, you -
I got it.
We've got forty-five minutes to save this city -
No, I've got forty-five minutes to get clear of the blast radius, because you don't stand a chance against these guys. 143.
With your help I might. She shakes her head.
I'll open that tunnel, then I'm gone. He looks at her.
There's more to you than that. She stares back at him. Facade slipping a touch.
Sorry to keep letting you down. He says nothing. She looks at him, imploring. Come with me. Save yourself. You don't owe these people anymore - you've given them everything...
Not everything. Not yet. Batman turns. Catwoman watches him go. Then fires up the bike and takes off.
Catwoman tears along on the Bat-Pod. She pulls up at the tunnel entrance blocked by stacked vehicles.

The army of Cops stands at the low end of the street. At op is Bane's stronghold - City Hall. Men pour out of the building, forming up into an opposing line. A Cop wearing full dress blues steps forward. It is Foley The silence is eerie... The numbers look evenly matched - until two Tumblers arrive.
The Cops look shaky, pale, but determined. 144.
There's only one police in this city. He steps forward. The line follows.
Bane stands in the colonnade. Watching.
Open fire.

The Tumblers FIRE into the line of Cops, THROWING men int the air, SCREAMING. The line of Cops is about to scatter WHOOOSHHH. The Bat DROPS down in front of the Cops and BLASTS both Tumblers, FLIPPING them sideways. The Bat RIS and the cops run towards the Mercenaries, firing - until they are close enough to fight hand-to-hand. The street i filled with thousands of men in pitched battle.
Catwoman, hearing the distant battle, blasts the tunnel blockage...the dust settles. Her path is clear.
Gordon heard the fighting. Checks the box. Nervous.
Come on, come on...
Bane strides through the battle, taking out Cops left and right. A space clears - he is face the face with the Batman...
You came back. To die with your city.

No. I came back to stop you. 145. Bane leaps at Batman, smashing powerful blows into his he Batman ducks, weaves and smashes his fists into Bane's si Someone is watching from the window of City Hall - Mirand

The black truck rounds the corner. Gordon signals his man a Greyhound bus - who pulls across the street. The truck smashes into the bus and stops. Gordon and his men swarm blasting at the Guards. Gordon opens the back - empty. No bomb. Wrong truck.
That's impossible... Come on! Cut over to Fifth! They sprint for the next parallel avenue...
Fox hurries into the reactor - starts throwing switches..
Blake leads the boys out of the home - points down the street.

Knock on doors, spread the word - the bomb's going to blow! Get out by the South Street tunnel, or over the bridge! Do two blocks, then get back to the bus! The boys race down the street. Father Reilly climbs into bus.
Batman and Bane fight, Batman pushing Bane back - a Tumbl roars between them, separating them. Batman chases after. 146.
Bane SMASHES backwards through the door, Batman on him. Batman POUNDS Bane against the marble floor. Mercenaries guarding Miranda move towards them -

Stay back. He is mine - Bane SMASHES Batman's head - moves in for the kill, but Batman SMASHES Bane to the ground, RIPS sideways across t tubes of Bane's mask with the blades of his forearm. Bane bellows, thrashing in AGONY. Batman holds him down with a hand on his throat - searches him with his free hand.
Give me the trigger! You'd never give it to an ordinary citizen - Bane's thrashing calms as he stares at Batman through pain-soaked eyes...gasping through his broken mask for relief.
I broke you. How have you come back?
You thought you were the only one who could learn the strength to escape? Bane looks at Batman, curiosity behind his pain.
I never escaped - R 's al Gh l
rescued me. That is why I must fulfill his plan. That is why I must avenge his murder.
The child of R 's al Gh l made the
But he is not the child of R 's al
Gh l...
Batman flinches, frozen as Miranda leans into his ear... 147.
I am. Miranda has a knife through Batman's suit, into his ribs. And though I am not 'ordinary', I am a citizen... She pulls out the trigger...

Gordon spots the second black truck moving down the stree His men pull in front, slowing it. Gordon jumps into the back. The truck accelerates - Gordon drops, hanging on to the bumper, struggling with the box, trying to turn it on
Batman cannot move to defend himself. He has Bane by the throat, but Miranda has her knife in his side -

My mother named me Talia before she was killed. The way I would've been killed if not for my protector...Bane. INSERT CUT: the child, Talia, makes eye-contact with the Protector, then leaps. Down below, Prisoners swarm over t protector, ripping the muslin from his face. Bane looks u at Talia, says one quiet word -
Goodbye. Then is overrun.

I climbed out of the pit... INSERT CUT: Young Talia stands by the hole looking out at the landscape... I found my father and brought him back to exact terrible vengeance - but by that time...the prisoners and the doctor had done their work to my friend...my protector... Talia reaches up to touch Bane's mask. 148. INSERT CUT: the League of Shadows descend into the prison at their head, R 's al Gh l. They slaughter prisoners. Th
stop. R 's al Gh l has found Bane, bandaged.
The League took us in. Trained us...
Bane in a prototype mask, stands on logs, blocking blows from men with sticks.
But my father could not accept Bane. R 's al Gh l watches Bane training. Turns away.
Talia looks into Bane's eyes as she holds the knife in Batman's side.

He saw only a monster who could never be tamed. Whose very existence was a reminder of the hell he'd left his wife to die in. He excommunicated Bane from the League of Shadows. His only crime was that he loved me. I could not truly forgive my father... Talia looks at Batman, cold. Until you murdered him.
He was trying to kill millions of innocent people -

'Innocent' is a strong word to throw around Gotham, Bruce. I honor my father by finishing his work. Vengeance against the man who killed him is simply a reward for my patience... Talia twists the knife in Batman's side. You see, it's the slow knife...the knife that takes its time, the
knife that waits years without forgetting, then slips quietly between bones...that's the knife - Talia arms the trigger... - that cuts deepest. She hits the button - nothing.
A light on the metal box is blinking. Gordon hangs on -
Talia turns, furious.
Your knife may have been too slow... A Mercenary steps forward -
The truck's under attack - Talia looks around, mind racing.

Gordon. (To Batman.) You gave him a way to block my signal. No matter - (Looks at watch.) He's bought Gotham eleven minutes. (Shouts at Mercenary.) Prepare a convoy. We must secure the bomb until it detonates. Talia jumps to her feet. Bane grabs a shotgun from a Mercenary - points it at Batman.

Not yet... I want him to feel the heat. (To Batman.) Feel the fire of twelve million souls you failed. Talia reaches up to Bane's mask, reconnects his tubes, tenderly. Goodbye, my friend. Bane nods at her, slowly. Talia moves out with the Mercenaries. 150.

Talia gets into a Tumbler with a Mercenary. Three Tumbler pull out in convoy, blowing anything out of the way - car cops. Foley stands in the road, firing his sidearm. Talia's Tumbler SMASHES him out of the way.
Bane grabs Batman, throws him into the floor - checks the rounds in the barrels.

You'll have to imagine the fire - He shuts the gun - jams it into Batman's face. We both know I need to kill you now. He squeezes the trigger. BLAMMM! Bane is blasted across t lobby by cannon fire. Catwoman is there, on the Bat-Pod.
The whole no-guns thing? I don't feel as strongly about it as you do.
Blake pulls up to the barricade, leads the kids off, marching them up the bridge, Father Reilly at the rear. A Uniform shouts through the loudhailer -
Stay there! What are you doing?!
Blake, MCU - I'm getting these boys to safety -
Safety?! You're gonna get us all killed. Anyone crosses this bridge they blow the city - 151.
It's gonna blow anyway. We need this bridge open right now.
No one leaves the island. Orders -
Whose orders? Bane's?
Police Department's.
Haven't you heard the shooting? The Batman's battling it out with Bane
The Batman's dead. Look, Officer -
It's Detective -
Well, Detective, you take one more step, we have to shoot you. Two more steps, we have to blow the bridge.
(to the boys) Wait for me back at the bus. The Boys walk back down the bridge...
Talia's convoy surrounds the black truck. Tumblers off ea flank, protecting the bomb as it counts down...
Batman looks at Catwoman.
I need you on the ground, me in the air, we have to force that convoy east, to the entrance to the
Catwoman roars down the steps on the Bat-Pod.
Gordon climbs into the back of the truck - the bomb is there, heating up. He looks at the countdown - nine minutes...
Blake turns back to the Uniform.
Your orders are out of date! The situation's changed! Listen, I'm a cop like you. And I'm walking out there. Please don't shoot me. Blake walks. Shots ring out at his feet. He keeps walking

The Bat descends on the convoy, Catwoman approaches on th ground. A rolling battle ensues. Catwoman targets the rea of the Tumblers, Batman swings the Bat in low at the junctions, trying to force the convoy east... The Tumbler's gun turrets swing around onto Catwoman. She swerves to avoid heavy fire.
Blake continues to walk, ignoring the warning shots.
Son-of-a-bitch! (To his partner.) Blow it! Before he reaches the line
His partner arms the detonator. Uniform shouts at Blake -
Get down! We're blowing the bridge! As Blake looks, disbelieving, the bridge in front of him blasts upwards in a massive fireball. Blake dives backwar 153.

The Bat blasts away in front of the convoy, making a huge crater in front of a Tumbler and trapping it, rear in the air. Catwoman dodges around it, uses the Bat-Pod cannons take out another Tumbler... The countdown ticks away...se minutes.
As Fox fires up the reactor something catches his eye - something is wrong...
The smoke clears, Blake sees the impossible gap.
You idiots! You sons of bitches! You're killing us!!

Gordon climbs out the back of the truck but is immediatel strafed by gunfire from the Tumblers. He dives back insid moves to the front of the trailer - looks at the bulkhead gauging the driver's position. Starts firing blind throug the bulkhead -
Bullets fly through the cab. The driver takes one, falls forward, dead. Talia takes the wheel - bullets keep comin
Blake races back. Father Reilly has the boys in a huddle,
Father! Get the boys on the bus -
But there's nowhere to go, son. 154.
The Bat spins down in front of the black truck, forcing i into a hard right turn...
Talia watches the navigation screen.
They're trying to force us onto
Pushing us to the entrance of the reactor. They're going to try and reconnect the core.
Can they? Talia smiles.
Fox runs to a ladder. Alarms sound. As he hits the ladder turns. A massive rumble builds - water SMASHES into the reactor, flooding in from both directions.

Catwoman comes up behind the lead Tumbler. She blasts it again and again - it flips diagonally into the path of th black truck, causing the truck to lurch onto its side. Bo vehicles careen into the mouth of the tunnel.
Fox loops his arm around a rung of the ladder and braces a wave smashes into him, painfully... 155.
Gordon jumps out of the truck, opening the rear doors to expose the glowing core. Catwoman pulls up on the Bat-Pod

Give me a hand! The Bat lands at the tunnel mouth. Gordon moves in to try and grab the core but it is too hot. Let's get a cable on it and drag it out! Come on, we're almost there - Laughter. Gordon turns. Talia, lying half out the truck. Dying.
Fox showed me how to operate the reactor core. Including the emergency flood -
Fox pulls himself above the rising whitewater -
Gordon looks down at Talia. Batman is at his side.

There is no way to stop this bomb. Prepare yourselves... (Looks up at Batman.) My father's work is done. Talia smiles as her eyes flutter closed. Gordon turns - Batman is at the core, plunging his hands into the heat t attach a hoist from the Bat.
What're you doing?
Two minutes. I can fly it out over the bay... Catwoman is at his side as he works.
Rig it out to fly over the water, then bail - 156.
No autopilot. She takes this in. He stands to face her.
You could've gone anywhere. Been anything. But you came back here.
So did you.
I guess we're both suckers. She puts her arms around his neck. Kisses him. Batman mov to the Bat, Gordon alongside.
So this is the part where you vanish, only this time you don't come back? Batman opens the canopy.
Blake grabs at the smallest boys, shoving them onto the b
Come on! On the bus!
What're you doing?
Protection from the blast -
It's an atom bomb -! Blake turns on Father Reilly, furious.
You think they need to hear that in their last seconds? You think I'm going to let them die without hope? 157.
Gordon puts a hand on Batman's arm.
I never cared who you were -
And you were right.
But shouldn't the people know the hero who saved them?

A hero can be anyone. That was always the point. Batman sits into the cockpit, then looks again at Gordon. Anyone. A man doing something as simple and reassuring as putting a coat around a little boy's shoulders to let him know that the world hadn't ended... The canopy closes - and as the Bat fires up Gordon rememb
INSERT CUT: Gordon, in his uniform, wraps the overcoat around the Young Bruce's shoulders, his eyes reassuring, loving. Gordon looks up to the cockpit -

Bruce Wayne? - but is dusted by downdraft as the Bat RISES. Gordon LEA out of the way as the core is dragged along and out of th tunnel mouth. The Bat struggles with the weight of the smoking core... building is in the way - Batman fights the controls but there's no power to get over it.
Blake shouts into the bus -
Heads down! Heads down, now! 158.
Blake, they need to make their peace. Blake turns to him, furious.

They're children! They have no peace to make - An EXPLOSION from downtown Gotham. Blake looks across, startled, turns to the children on the bus. Get down! This is it! The smallest of the boys stares through the window past Blake.

No. That's Batman! Blake turns to see the Bat thundering out of the heart of Gotham, trailing smoke, the core hanging from it. It curv dangerously close to the bridge before heading for the mo of the river...the bay...the ocean... Until a point of light fires into an enormous nuclear BLA - wind and light and dust blowing VIOLENTLY but harmlessl over the bridge, the tunnel mouth, all of Gotham... As the nuclear dawn fades over Gotham, and we see its inhabitants start to raise their heads, and helicopters a boats converge on the island, we hear a voice. Jim Gordon
'I see a beautiful city and a brilliant people rising from this abyss...' Blake pulls out his badge. Throws it into the river.
'I see the lives for which I lay down my life, peaceful, useful, prosperous and happy...'
Gordon is reading from A Tale of Two Cities. Opposite is Fox, arm in a sling, and Blake, grim. Another figure is there, whose face we do not yet see... 159.

'I see that I hold a sanctuary in their hearts, and in the hearts of their descendants, generations hence. It is a far, far better thing that I do, than I have ever done...' Gordon closes the book, looking down at Bruce Wayne's gra 'It is a far, far better rest that I go to than I have ever known.' Gordon looks up at the figure standing across from him... Alfred. Tears streaming. Fox places a gentle hand on Alfred's shoulder, then leave Gordon and Blake follow. Alfred, alone with the Wayne family, turns to the grave beside Bruce's - the grave of Thomas and Martha Wayne.
I'm so sorry. I failed you. You trusted me, and I failed you. And the old man's shoulders begin to shake with sobs.
Gordon nods at Lucius. Blake is at Gordon's side.
Can I change your mind about quitting the force?
No. What you said about structures. About shackles. I can't take it. The injustice. (Gestures at gardens.) I mean...no one's ever going to know who saved an entire city.
They know. (Off look.) It was Batman. 160.
Gordon, on a platform with dignitaries, watches a statue being unveiled. The curtain parts: Batman, immortalized i granite. We move in on the stone face...
Mr. Wayne's will was not amended to reflect his more modest estate...
The voice belongs to Wayne's lawyer, addressing a small group.
Nonetheless, there are considerable assets to dispose of... The contents of the house are to be
He glances up to see someone slip into the room - Blake.
Movers carefully bring artworks and furniture out of the house, watched by a solitary figure. Alfred.
- to settle the estate's accounts. The remainder is left in its entirety to Alfred J. Pennyworth...
Blake shifts. Out of place. The Lawyer continues.
The house and grounds are left to the city of Gotham, on condition that they never be demolished, altered, or otherwise interfered
Different movers carry bunk beds into the huge house.

And that they shall be used for one purpose, and one purpose only... A schoolbus pulls up. Father Reilly shepherds children towards the house. The children look up at the house, wide-eyed. The housing and care of the city's at-risk and orphaned children. A sign reads:

head_text.subj: THE MARTHA AND THOMAS WAYNE HOME FOR CHILDREN

text: People file out as the Lawyer stands.
My clerk will help anyone with the smaller correspondences and instructions... Blake approaches the Clerk. She smiles.
Blake, John.
Nothing here. Blake realizes, offers her his driving license.
Try my legal name. The Clerk glances at the license. Checks.
Yup, here it is. She reaches down behind the desk, sorting through various items, and hands him a sports bag. Blake takes it, curiou
You should use your full name. I like that name... Robin. 162. Blake smiles, embarrassed. Leaves.
Any word on the missing item?
No, not yet.
Well, they'd better leave no stone unturned... We can't just put a string of pearls on the manifest as 'lost'.
Fox stands in front of the second camouflage rotor. Two Techs are examining the controls in the cockpit.
Why worry about the stabilization software? This whole autopilot system's obsolete -
Please, I just need to know what I could've done to fix it.
But Mr. Fox, it's already been fixed. (Typed on panel.) Software patch...six months ago.
Check the user ident on the patch... Tech 2 types some more keys. Looks surprised.
Huh. Bruce Wayne. Fox turns away from the rotor, an idea starting to form..

Blake sits in his car looking at a GPS device, puzzled. Beside him, the sports bag, open. In it is a piece of pap with coordinates, on top of some climbing rope and shackl Blake gets out of the car with the bag. Follows the GPS i the trees. 163.
Alfred, paper under his arm, heads to his usual table. Si
Lei e solo?
Si, Fernet Branca, per cortesia.
Blake finds a large waterfall... He checks his GPS, confused. Stares at the waterfall. Reaches for the climbi gear...
Gordon steps onto the roof with his pile of arrest reports...
As Alfred sips his drink, he glances up at a couple at th next table. Strangers. Alfred looks back down...
Moving in on the waterfall from inside... Blake bursts through, landing painfully on the shale inside. he gets t his feet, moving cautiously into the cave...

Gordon bangs his files against the air duct, straightenin them. He stops. Sees something. The searchlight...fixed. Gordon runs his fingers across a brand new, steel Bat symbol... He looks up into the night...
Blake lights his torch...then ducks, crouching, as THOUSA of SCREECHING creatures descend. BATS... 164.

Alfred folds his paper. Pulls out his money, then stops, seeing...across the tables, a familiar couple... Bruce smiles at Alfred, who nods. Bruce turns back to the prett brunette in pearls. Selina. Alfred pays his bill, content
Blake lifts his head, FEELING the bats all around him... Blake RISES, and is SWALLOWED by the darkness of their wi and we - FADE OUT. CREDITS. THE END.
